column3: Usage: opta [options] [command] Agentic AI coding CLI powered by local LLMs Options: -V, --version output the version number -v, --verbose detailed output --debug debug info including API calls -h, --help display help for command Commands:
Usage: opta onboard [options] Run guided first-run setup wizard Options: -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta chat [options] Start an interactive AI chat session Options: -r, --resume <id> resume a previous session --plan plan mode — read-only, design implementation approach --review code review mode — read-only, structured review outpu

Usage: opta tui [options] Start full-screen terminal UI (alias for `opta chat --tui`) Options: -r, --resume <id> resume a previous session --plan plan mode — read-only, design implementation approach --review code review mode — read-only, s

Usage: opta do [options] <task...> Execute a coding task using the agent loop Options: -m, --model <name> use specific model for this task --device <host[:port]> target LLM network device host (optionally with port) -f, --format <type> outp

Usage: opta embed [options] <text...> Create embeddings via Opta LMX helper nodes Options: -m, --model <id> embedding model id --device <host[:port]> target LLM network device host (optionally with port) --remote use configured remote conne

Usage: opta rerank [options] <query...> Rerank candidate documents via Opta LMX Options: -d, --documents <docs> pipe-separated documents, e.g. "doc1|doc2|doc3" -m, --model <id> reranker model id --device <host[:port]> target LLM network dev

Usage: opta benchmark [options] Generate Opta benchmark suite apps (landing, chess, AI-news research) Options: -o, --output <dir> output directory (default: ./apps/opta-benchmark-suite) --query <text> override AI news research query --words

Usage: opta status [options] Check Opta LMX server health and loaded models Options: --device <host[:port]> target LLM network device host (optionally with port) --remote use configured remote connection host (alias for --device from config

Usage: opta models [options] [action] [args...] List and manage loaded models Arguments: action list | manage | dashboard | scan | use | info | load | unload | stop | swap | alias | aliases | unalias | download | delete | benchmark | predic

Usage: opta env [options] [action] [name] Manage named environment profiles Arguments: action list | show | save | use | delete name profile name Options: --host <host> override connection host when saving --port <port> override connection

Usage: opta config [options] [action] [key] [value] Manage configuration Arguments: action get | set | list | reset | menu key config key value config value Options: --json output as JSON -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta sessions [options] [action] [id] Manage chat sessions Arguments: action resume | delete | export | search id session id or search query Options: --json machine-readable output --model <name> filter by model name --source <mode>
Usage: opta init [options] Initialize OPIS project intelligence docs Options: -y, --yes skip prompts, use defaults (CI mode) --force overwrite existing APP.md -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta diff [options] Show changes made in a session (V2) Options: -s, --session <id> session to diff -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta serve [options] [action] Manage the remote Opta LMX inference server Arguments: action start | stop | restart | logs (default: status) Options: --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta update [options] Update Opta components (CLI, LMX, Plus; optional Web) on local/remote targets Options: -c, --components <list> comma-separated components: cli,lmx,plus,web (default: cli,lmx,plus) -t, --target <mode> target mode

Usage: opta server [options] Start an HTTP API server for non-interactive use Options: -p, --port <port> server port (default: "3456") --host <host> server bind address (default: "127.0.0.1") -m, --model <name> override default model -h, --

Usage: opta doctor [options] Check Opta setup, inference auth, and host failover Options: --json machine-readable output -f, --format <type> output format (text, json) -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta completions [options] <shell> Generate shell completions (bash/zsh/fish) Options: -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta account [options] [command] Manage Supabase-native account authentication Options: -h, --help display help for command Commands: signup [options] Create an account using email or phone + password login [options] Log in with emai

Usage: opta account signup [options] Create an account using email or phone + password Options: --identifier <emailOrPhone> email or phone --name <name> display name --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta account login [options] Log in with email or phone + password Options: --identifier <emailOrPhone> email or phone --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta account status [options] Show local account session status Options: --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta account logout [options] Log out and clear local account session Options: --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta key [options] [command] Manage Opta inference API keys for OpenAI-compatible clients Options: -h, --help display help for command Commands: create [options] Create or rotate inference API key and sync to Studio LMX show [options

Usage: opta key create [options] Create or rotate inference API key and sync to Studio LMX Options: --value <key> use explicit key value instead of generating one --no-remote skip syncing key to Studio LMX config --no-copy skip copying key

Usage: opta key show [options] Show current inference API key (masked by default) Options: --reveal print full key value --copy copy key to clipboard --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta key copy [options] Copy current inference API key to clipboard Options: --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta mcp [options] [command] Manage MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers Options: -h, --help display help for command Commands: list [options] Show configured MCP servers add [options] <name> <command> Add a stdio MCP server add-play
Usage: opta mcp list [options] Show configured MCP servers Options: --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta mcp add [options] <name> <command> Add a stdio MCP server Options: --env <pairs> environment variables (KEY=VAL,KEY2=VAL2) -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta mcp add-playwright [options] Add a Playwright MCP server using browser config defaults Options: --name <name> server name (default: playwright) --mode <mode> browser mode: isolated|attach --command <command> command runner (defa
Usage: opta mcp remove [options] <name> Remove an MCP server Options: -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta mcp test [options] <name> Test connection to an MCP server Options: -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta daemon [options] [command] Manage Opta Level 3 daemon runtime Options: -h, --help display help for command Commands: start [options] Start daemon in background (or attach if already running) run [options] Run daemon in foregroun

Usage: opta daemon start [options] Start daemon in background (or attach if already running) Options: --host <host> bind host (default: "127.0.0.1") --port <port> preferred port (default: "9999") --json machine-readable output -h, --help di

Usage: opta daemon run [options] Run daemon in foreground (internal) Options: --host <host> bind host (default: "127.0.0.1") --port <port> preferred port (default: "9999") --token <token> daemon session token --model <name> model override f
Usage: opta daemon stop [options] Stop daemon Options: -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta daemon status [options] Show daemon status Options: --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta daemon logs [options] Show daemon logs Options: --json machine-readable output -h, --help display help for command

Usage: opta keychain [options] [command] Manage API keys in the OS secure keychain (macOS Keychain / Linux secret-tool) Options: -h, --help display help for command Commands: status Show keychain availability and stored key presence set-ant
Usage: opta keychain status [options] Show keychain availability and stored key presence Options: -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta keychain set-anthropic [options] <key> Store an Anthropic API key in the OS keychain Options: -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta keychain set-lmx [options] <key> Store an LMX API key in the OS keychain Options: -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta keychain delete-anthropic [options] Remove the Anthropic API key from the OS keychain Options: -h, --help display help for command
Usage: opta keychain delete-lmx [options] Remove the LMX API key from the OS keychain Options: -h, --help display help for command

Model Commands opta models interactive manager (TTY) or list opta models list list loaded models opta models history show recent model activity opta models manage open interactive model manager opta models use [name] switch default (fuzzy +
